div.p: ref may be used in a variety of ways in an encoded finding aid. For example, ref may provide an internal link from one c to another related c in the same way that See and See also references direct readers of paper-based finding aids. Or, ref might be used to direct the reader from text in a scope and content note to a description of a c in a contents list. ref might also point to an external file, for example, a finding aid for a related collection at another repository.

list.item: Use ptr to provide a reference to a file when text or child elements that describe the referenced object are not needed, for example, when providing an image to be embedded in the finding aid.
Use target to link to another element within the finding aid.
Use href to link to or embed an external file.
Use linkrole to provide a URI that characterizes the nature of the remote resource to which ref links.
Use arcrole to provide a URI that characterizes the nature of the link itself.

div.p: Within ptrgrp: One of ptr or ref is required, repeatable
Within all other parents: Optional, repeatable
